clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Intensive and Standard Training for Human Insulin Inhalation Powder (HIIP)
clinical_study.official_title: Standard Training Versus Intensive Training for HIIP Delivery System Usage in Insulin-Na√Øve Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare intensive and standard training for human insulin inhalation powder in patients with type 2 diabetes.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypothesis that std training for HIIP system is noninferior to intensive training by 1.2 mmol/L with respect to overall 2-hr postprandial glucose excursion of (SMBG) in type 2 diabetes patients that have been on preprandial trmt with HIIP

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the suitability of the HIIP delivery system for type 2 diabetes patients

Compare the SMBG profiles of preprandial HIIP administration with standard training and with intensive training Assess patient compliance with the HIIP delivery system Directions for Use (DFU) provided by the Sponsor with and without intensive training
Compare the test meal blood glucose profiles of preprandial HIIP administration with standard training and with intensive training

intervention.description: Inhalation, capsule, TID 3 times per day min 6 IU max 60 IU
Inhalation, Capsule, TID 3 times per day min 6 IU max 60 IU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes for at least 12 months
- Age 18 or older.
- Taking at least 1 oral antihyperglycemic medication.
- Have an HbA1C between 7.5 and 12.
- Be a nonsmoker
Exclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index (BMI) greater than 40.
- Have frequent episodes of severe hypoglycemia.
- Have advanced autonomic neuropathy.
- Have history of asthma.
- Have chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
